items.description: Led backend and machine learning efforts, managing databases, data imports and exports. Directed a major ML project to cluster offers into products for price comparison and performed text classification to categorize millions of offers into a 2000+ leaf category tree.

Developed a system for automated lifecycle management, monitoring, and deployment, including automated machine setup, a comprehensive alerting system, and a Python-based RPM package manager with a MySQL backend.
Single Sign On Integration using [django-saml2-auth](https://github.com/grafana/django-saml2-auth) and [PySAML2](https://github.com/IdentityPython/pysaml2).

Designed and implemented software architecture for stock-flow consistent economic models, leveraging an event-driven approach with a message bus, and built a [Django](https://djangoproject.com)-based web interface and API enriched with [htmx](https://htmx.org), [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com), and [Alpine.js](https://alpinejs.dev).
Developed a Django-based system for workplace hazard information collection, employing domain-driven design and generating substantial, high-quality PDF reports directly from the web interface.
Led a [workshop](https://github.com/ephes/pytest-course) on effective PyTest usage, featuring a Mastodon client built on Django as the practical example project.
Conducted a comprehensive, week-long introduction to Python, covering all foundational language concepts.

Developed a context-aware advertising system, including a [Django](https://www.djangoproject.com/)-based social media downloader with [youtube-dl](https://ytdl-org.github.io/youtube-dl/), management of long video and audio transcripts, TV ratings forecasting using SARIMA models, and a GraphQL API built with Graphene.
Developed an automatic receipt handling system to recognize key details like date, amount, and tax, along with Django apps for invoicing and a PWA for documenting construction defects.
Developed an automated hotel room pricing system using SARIMA models to forecast click prices by market, date range, and target hotel, with optimal room rates calculated from the forecasts.

Built machine learning models for automated bidding on hotel room clicks, combining classical methods like [logistic regression](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LogisticRegression.html) and [XGBoost](https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost) with a custom deep learning model developed in [Keras](https://keras.io/).
Developed machine learning models to extract structured data from product detail pages, along with a Django-based backend and database to support data labeling frontends.

Built machine learning models to predict user attributes like age, gender, and income from browsing history, using [scikit-learn](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/index.html) and [XGBoost](https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost), and conducted extensive analysis in [Jupyter Notebooks](https://jupyter.org/) for the first time.
Developed a [Django REST Framework](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) API as the backend for mobile meter-reading apps, with robust authentication and permission management.
Developed a [Django REST Framework](https://www.django-rest-framework.org/tutorial/quickstart/) API as the backend for image handling.
Built a Django backend for a large German events website, featuring extensive asynchronous imports of multiple event feeds.

items.title: Python Podcast
items.description: A popular German-speaking podcast about the [Python](https://www.python.org/) programming language, which I co-host and produce alongside Dominik Geldmacher.

items.title: django-cast
items.description: A podcast hosting platform built with Django and [Wagtail](https://wagtail.org/), used to host the Python Podcast. I’m especially proud of its responsive image capabilities.

items.title: Weeknotes
items.description: Since 2021, I’ve been writing weeknotes to document my work and life—a valuable way to reflect on achievements and track my progress.

items.title: PlastInvest
items.description: PlastInvest is a tool designed for governments, offering quantitative and qualitative insights into the investments required to implement national action plans for reducing plastic waste and pollution.

items.title: Data Science Tutorial
items.description: This tutorial covers topics that, for one reason or another, I find relevant or intriguing. Enjoy!

items.title: kptncook
items.description: A lightweight command-line client for downloading [KptnCook](https://www.kptncook.com/) recipes, with export capabilities for [mealie](https://mealie.io/) and [Paprika](https://www.paprikaapp.com/).

items.title: PlasticIQ
items.description: PlasticIQ is a data-driven digital platform designed to help companies eliminate plastic waste.

items.title: fastdeploy
items.description: A web backend for automated project deployment with real-time progress updates, featuring a [Vue.js](https://vuejs.org/) WebSocket frontend and optional integration with htmx and polling.

items.title: Serving Files with Django
items.description: Explored various methods for serving files with Django, developed a benchmarking tool for comparison, and presented the findings at DjangoCon Europe 2021.

items.title: cast-vue
items.description: A [Vue.js](https://vuejs.org) frontend for [django-cast](https://github.com/ephes/django-cast), demonstrating the feasibility of building a complete frontend solely through the API.

items.title: Django Async
items.description: Wrote an in-depth blog post on the new async capabilities in Django 3.1, also published in print by the German magazine [entwickler.de](https://entwickler.de/python/django-wird-asynchron).

items.title: Konektom
items.description: Konektom.org is a collaborative bookmarking service built on Django, featuring an intuitive faceted navigation interface.

about.text: As a long term Python developer I've seen a lot of different projects over the years. And I always had a lot of fun building stuff, never thinking of my work just as a job. Nowadays I mostly work with Python, but don't mind using other languages and tools to build complete products.

identity.name: Jochen Wersdörfer
identity.tagline: Freelance Software developer doing mostly data science / machine learning and web development using Django.
identity.avatar_alt: Just in case you need to steal a picture of Jochen

items.title: Hey there!
items.text: I'm [Jochen Wersdörfer](https://wersdoerfer.de/jochen/), a freelance software developer based in [Düsseldorf, Germany](https://www.google.com/maps/place/D%C3%BCsseldorf/). I started working in the software and internet industry at [web.de](https://web.de/) shortly after the dotcom bubble burst - just when people realized that most of the fun was over.

items.title: A Journey Through Code
items.text: Over the years, I've tackled projects of all shapes and sizes—collaborating with industry giants like [Otto Group](https://www.ottogroup.com/) and [RTL](https://www.rtl.de/), as well as innovative startups like [trivago](https://www.trivago.com/) and [billiger.de](https://www.billiger.de/). In 2019, I had the unique experience of attending a [conference talk](https://2019.pycon.de/program/pydata-fdvfhx-10-years-of-automated-category-classification-for-product-data-johannes-knopp/) about my first big machine learning project, which had run successfully in production for over a decade before gracefully retiring.

items.title: Python and Beyond
items.text: [Python](https://www.python.org/)is my trusty sidekick—why wrestle with convoluted syntax when you can keep it sleek and readable? It's my language of choice for crafting machine learning models and building backend web applications. When I'm not coding, I'm chatting on my [German Python-Podcast](https://python-podcast.de/show/) or penning thoughts on [my blog](https://wersdoerfer.de/blogs/ephes_blog/). Lately, I've been all-in on [Django](https://www.djangoproject.com/)'s exciting evolution, especially with how tools like [htmx](https://htmx.org) are bringing server-side rendering back in style. And guess what? I've even started learning CSS to sprinkle some extra magic on the front end!

items.title: Ready to Collaborate?
items.text: If you're on the hunt for someone who can jump into your project and start making a difference from day one, look no further. While Python is my main jam, I'm also well-versed in JavaScript, SQL, and a handful of other technologies like Vue.js and PostgreSQL. Picking up new languages or tools? Challenge accepted!

items.title: Team Opportunities
items.text:
Here's something exciting I've been thinking about: Maybe you have a project that needs not just an extra individual contributor, but an entire development team. I've worked with a lot of talented people over the years, and there are a few I'd love to collaborate with again. The best part? They're eager to join forces too, so there's a fresh win-win situation just waiting to be tapped.
  

So, whether you need a seasoned developer or a full-fledged team, I'm just an email away. Click the button below or drop me a line at [jochen-resume@wersdoerfer.de](mailto:jochen-resume@wersdoerfer.de), and let's turn your ideas into reality—and maybe have some fun along the way!


Cheers,
Jochen
